definition: and/furthermore/also/together with/(not) at all/simultaneously/to combine/to join/to merge

sentences.english: Commander in Chief confidence Man Manbing said that Durante will return the young vanguard position.
sentences.chinese: 主帅信心满满并称杜兰特将回归小前锋位置。

sentences.english: Unionist immediately rejected the idea, calling it a betrayal.
sentences.chinese: 统一党马上拒绝了此方案，并称其为背叛。

sentences.english: 'Yaojia' was a famous combined call in middle and night Tang dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 姚贾是唐诗史中著名的并称之一。

sentences.english: She has denied the charges as political purges.
sentences.chinese: 季莫申科否认所有指控并称这是政治迫害。

definition: person (first person, second person etc in grammar)/called/known as
to be known as/to be nicknamed/to be purportedly/to claim (often exaggeratedly or falsely)
called/to call sth (by a name)/to name
to acclaim/to sing the praises of

the four elements: earth, water, fire, and wind (Buddhism)/the four freedoms: speaking out freely, airing views fully, holding great debates, and writing big-character posters, 大鳴大放|大鸣大放[da4 ming2 da4 fang4], 大辯論|大辩论[da4 bian4 lun4], 大字報|大字报[da4 zi4 bao4] (PRC)
one of (sth)/one out of a multitude/one (third, quarter, percent etc)
it is rumored that .../it is reported that ...
to be called/to be known as
